Overall%20Experience.Review: Carnegie Mellon University is a really tough school, especially for computer science. You will find that the schoolwork is quite heavy and there is a ton of homework. However, I've met some of the smartest people here at school. Everyone is really bright and motivated. The career services here are quite good as well. CMU attracts some of the top companies, especially in tech, so hopefully you will be able to find internships and full time positions easily.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Carnegie Mellon is an unconventional school. Extremely smart and nerdy CS kids study at Gates while incredibly talented musicians and actors perform in CFA. In between, you find students concentrating in all sorts of fields: engineering, business, statistics, math, psychology... The strength of this school lies within this observation. Carnegie Mellon is great in various fields, so no matter what you study here you will be learning a great deal. In addition, the network you can build here is immense. Despite being a relatively small school, CMU offers plenty of interesting people who are enthusiastic, friendly, and passionate about their fields of study.

Finally, as we move towards the age of Artificial Intelligence (think Uber's self-driving cars in Pittsburgh) and the Internet of Things, there is no better place to be than CMU if you want to be on the cutting edge.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Carnegie Mellon is tough, no doubt about it. But it's also a place where you'll be pushed and surrounded by other talented and passionate people working hard too. You bond over that and I made awesome friends who will always be close no matter the years and distance. It can be very stressful, but making it through did convince me that I could persevere through anything, something that has benefitted me a lot out in the working world. I'll always prefer to hire CMU graduates because I of this.

Sports? Nah. Don't go there for sports. Campus? A lot better now then when I was there! Dorms? They're OK but moved off campus after 1st year. Parties? Well my group of friends had a lot of house parties but this was more Art, Design, Drama and random stragglers group ;) Pittsburgh? Wasn't convinced at the time (wanted to be in NYC) but it's a good place to go to school - enough to do, fairly safe, pretty cheap to live, plenty of arts and culture if you want it, decent food, etc.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Carnegie Mellon University is a great school. The academics are very high quality, and the coursework is challenging and interesting. There are a variety of people from all backgrounds and walks of life. Pittsburgh is a wonderful city, with activities of all kind in the surrounding neighborhoods.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: What is very interesting about Carnegie Mellons theatre program is that, yes they do put out professionals. But the thing is you become a very cruel human being that is only in it for themselves. Theater isn't about that. It is about the entire process and everyone involved. You have to be able to work with everyone and by doing so create relationships that could potentially get you more work. That doesn't necessarily have to just do with the theatre department. That could go go for whatever career interest you go into. Yes they have a great reputation but there is a difference from someone who Major's in Musical Theatre and an artist who truly appreciates it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: CMU students tend to be workaholics, but I think the school does a decent job of offering plenty of activities to diffuse that.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the diversity among the student population.  There are people of all different cultures and backgrounds.  One truly gains insight about people from all over the world!  One setback of the university is its lack of sufficient tutoring.  To receive individualized help, one must unfortunately do poorly on a quiz or exam before getting the proper help.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have enjoyed my time so far at Carnegie Mellon. The university itself is very challenging with brilliant professors and researchers. While many students that attend Carnegie Mellon are culturally diverse, a lot of people are motivated through high pressure situations. At times this could mean that students care more about their major and completing assignments and projects that socializing. However, being involved in one of the 200+ clubs is the best way to open up and meet others.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Im in the business school and first semester was pretty tough. It's very nonstop and you need good timemanaging skills. You meet a lot of people and will learn a lot about yourself.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Carnegie Mellon is a great place, full of really talented and smart MIT rejects. Although it's a bit too career oriented for my tastes (ie. everyone is all about jobs, no one really cares about grad school), the jobs kids at CMU get are great. The professors are wonderful, and because of the small size, you can expect to get a lot of individualized attention and care if you seek it out. Also wish CMU had an aerospace engineering program or more classes in theoretical math.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Carnegie Mellon University is a truly diverse community with highly intelligent people who strive to achieve realistic goals that enhance the quality of life. The school is especially well known for its majors related to science and technology.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: A wonderful institution overall. The campus is beautiful and peaceful located near other universities and a city. Great professors and lots of opportunities for extra help. Awesome student life activities. Various housing opportunities on and off campus. Truly a school that you will be proud to call your own.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: You won't be getting much out of your social life at CMU (the party scene is nonexistent, but you can still find parties if you really want to go out) because everyone is awkward and a hermit. However, the academics are stellar: extremely rigorous and tough. Students here are also ridiculously smart. It's both inspiring and intimidating, but so far I am enjoying myself, despite the sleep deprivation and constant stress.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Professors are so passionate and are willing to do their bests to help students learn. I get so much attention from the administration and I feel so motivated by the people I'm surrounded by.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Incredibly challenging academic environment. Regardless of your program, you will be pushed to your limits here; however, the sheer scale and reach of groundbreaking research and innovation that happens here will make it all worthwhile. By taking advantage of the incredible opportunities that are available here, you can race to the head of your field and will graduate prepared to take on just about any challenge.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The administration is working really diligently to address a lot of the social and cultural problems that Carnegie Mellon traditionally has, but it's still very much a transitional period. We're finally starting to talk about issues like mental health, diversity, and sexual assault, which is an important starting place, but there's still a lot of work to be done. Nothing about Carnegie Mellon is easy. You don't come here to have fun. You come here because you really want to work to be the best, which you never will be.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: All my professors have been very smart and care a lot about their students, however, not all have been great teachers. That has more to do with teaching style and what works best for you, I definitely recommend going to review sessions with the TA's since they've taken the course before and know what can help you.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love being part of such a passionate and hard-working community of people that are still willing to help each other out.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The professors are experts in their field and are happy to help with any issues that need addressing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I thoroughly enjoy my time at CMU and look forward to returning in the fall.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: There is a ton of different courses you can take that will challenge you and make you think critically to expand your thoughts. There is also a very diverse set of classes in different cultures and subjects. Professors are very helpful if you show interest and care about the subject being taught. Classes are not too huge, they range from 20 - 150 for the most part.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Carnegie Mellon has a vast amount of resources that students can take advantage of. In addition, professors are very supportive and peers are always willing to help. The classes are difficult, but this challenge better prepares students for the workforce. Pittsburgh is a great city as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: CMU has so much more to offer than you first expect. I found tons of great friends here who are extremely diverse, fun, and motivating. The academic rigor forces you to remember that above all, it's a place of learning and improving yourself. The general atmosphere is friendly and people are willing to work together to succeed. I've really enjoyed it here, and can't imagine a school with a better fit for me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: From what I've heard or already know of the school, it's great for academia.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are definitely POCs, although not enough black or hispanic students in my opinion.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I'm in a sorority - which was totally unexpected by friends and family - and I wouldn't have it any other way. I personally love greek life and am very grateful for all the people I've met through it. However, I do recognize issues with some frats being too big and not having the best brother/sisterhood. You don't have to join greek life to have fun at school, but if it's something you're at least considering or curious about I definitely recommend that you go to some of the rush/pre-rush events to get a feel for the community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The UC just got renovated and this included the addition of a new gym with fantastic cardio and weight lifting machines! There are a lot of athletes around campus but no one really pays attention to the games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is great diversity at CMU and the students/faculty are very accepting.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I do not have much knowledge of Greek life on my campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Most people are too focused on their workload to pay attention to our sports teams.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: CMU Greek Life is very different from other schools. Their is not the typical stereotypes about frats, everyone in Greek life is very inclusive of those not in Greek life. A lot of the social events are mainly Greek though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not a lot of school spirit in terms of supporting the sports team. Their usually are crowds for certain sports though (Football and Soccer). I wish there were more athletic facilities on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics isn't a huge part of student life at CMU. Many students take part in club and intramurals, and some are even able to manage varsity sports with a demanding course load. However, I wish that CMU was bigger into sporting events and school spirit.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Doesn't seem like there is much attention paid to football and other big sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I mean you don't come to cmu for sports
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life at CMU is the best thing about this university. Sororities and fraternities are filled with passionate, caring, amazing individuals who all do their part to better our campus, local, and global communities. Greek life is where many find not only their best friends and family, but also amazing post-grad opportunities and unmatched support throughout university and beyond.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics at CMU are beyond adequate for the student population. It's a smaller school that doesn't want to focus all of its funds on nice lockers. The priorities are correct for the student population.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: (Disclaimer: In my opinion, joining a fraternity or sorority is one of the biggest wastes of time for a college student.) A large percentage of students are in Greek orgs, and they basically are the people involved in everything social - from parties to student government to other organizations. Other students get involved, but Greek students definitely stay in the public eye much more often. Our frats range from complete a**holes to idiotic, and our srats from narcissistic b****es to desperate. We really get the whole spectrum here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: We have a few good teams, but no one really goes to games. Not much school spirit at all. And there are some gyms around campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: While the campus is very accepting towards everybody and advocates for diversity, the ethnic/racial diversity itself is a bit lacking. There aren't a lot of international students, and most of them come from China or India. Caucasian or Asian-Americans are the dominant ethnic groups as well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's there if you want it, but not necessary to join. Besides throwing parties, they mainly host a lot of fundraisers.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: People study A LOT so they don't really pay attention to sports. Football game turnouts are pretty low. But there's a lot of people who still participate in club sports. The gyms are pretty low quality and the varsity athletes get better equipment. But the school just finished building a new sports extension so hopefully that will be better.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I know their are people that are accepting
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am not the right person to comment on this.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I am not really involved in Athletics so I would not be the right person to comment on it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Hardly and school spirit but its nice to see that are teams do relatively well regardless
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: i have friends in greek life but there is no pressure to join one
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They have multiple workout facilities that are cleaned daily and offer various workout programs.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I myself am not in Greek life, but some of my friends are. No one is treated differently on campus if you are Greek vs if you are not Greek. It is what it is on campus, they have some influence, but not much at all.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Literally there might be negative fan support in general for our teams. Students definitely take advantage of the gyms and a lot of people go to work out, but no one really cares about our teams. Most of them are mediocre at best. Students would definitely rather go out to dinner or just hang out with their friends than go see a game, mainly because the students aren't particularly athletic. I myself am a huge college basketball fan, but the DIII quality makes me not want to go.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Sports aren't that important.  People participate in them for fun, but they aren't close to being a part of campus life.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: It's the same as everywhere you go. People get along within their niches.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletic culture is relatively separate from the rest of the school. Most people don't pay attention or care about it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm biased because I'm in a sorority, but it has helped me in so many ways (a community, upperclassmen for advice, help with the social scene). It's not for everyone, but I would definitely consider at least rushing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: This is one thing I'm pretty salty about at CMU... I go to Pitt for athletics. It's not really part of the mentality here, buggy is more popular.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are many options for students entering Greek life at CMU. The people who participate in Greek life are very open to non-Greeks, and they treat each other with respect. Greek life is not just about partying at CMU.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I personally have not attended any sports events, but from what I hear from my classmates, we have strong school spirit and our teams work hard.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is a decent amount of students involved in Greek life on campus, but it definitely doesn't make or break a person's social life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm personally not in Greek life, but all of the people who are with with whom I've interacted all say it's wonderful. The parties are great, of course, but the real thing is they do so much performance and service work, and it seems to be a real positive force at the school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: More marching band members show up to football games than actual audience members. To be honest, the marching band is more entertaining.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There is a lot of diversity on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I dont know alot about Greek life on campus. Its there, and they are a part of campus life, but I am not Greek, I only know about it through hear say.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: As a football player, the athletic dept. Is awesome. The facilities are top notch!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not very much attendance at any sporting events.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Very diverse and everyone is very accepting
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek-life is important on campus but isn't terrible if you don't join. It's not for everyone and people understand that.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We don't have the best athletic teams and we may not have school spirit in the athletic sense, but many people participate in intramurals and club sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: For the most part, people are genuinely nice.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: People aren't too into the athletics here. The main gym isn't the best, but the teams work hard and are worth supporting.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: They understand that we are college kids and they're first priority is to make sure that everyone is OK.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They are very lame at CMU and everyone not in the system makes fun of them religiously.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The skibo gym is the only free-weights gym on campus for non-athletes and it is really terrible. However, the new Tepper building that will be done in 2017-18 will have a 12,000 sqft gym that will be state of the art and accessible to all students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The only problem that I have had is with club creation. They pretend that it is very easy, but it is very hard and the students in charge of approving clubs deny a lot of clubs because they do not want to have to fund them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is a lot of diversity, however that diversity generally comes from foreign students that may/may not speak english. Honestly many people from India/singapore went to english-speaking schools and add a lot of diversity, while many asian foreign exchange students don't speak much english and usually stick together and don't usually socialize with outside cultures (not all- but most). Almost everyone is rich, and nobody really cares about much about where you're from or what you look like as long as you share the same passion.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: What can I say... it's a nerdy school. The stereotypes are pretty much true. I don't particularly notice the Guy/Girl ratio to be a problem unless you're in a high level robotics or ECE class. The guys are mostly unattractive. That being said, they are all nice and most people are friendly and kind. Everyone is intense and competitive and that serious culture carries over to dating. Girls tend to be more attractive then guys, but almost all attractive girls join sororities (there's a pretty stark contrast). Some girls care about their appearance and some don't, but girls be warned that although they may be nice, CMU guys are generally not that attractive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Those in them are very happy. Its definitely not the typical experience of a big school. There's no social separation in daily life and those in the sororities and frats are generally very happy with their choices.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Nobody really pays attention to sports. Many clubs and organizations have recreational sports, but nobody really cares about athletics.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's so easy to get around pittsburgh. It's cold a lot of the time, but the bus system is amazing, and passes are build into your CMU ID. Honestly, there are sometimes 4 or 5 busses waiting at each spot.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are a lot of international students, mostly from China, so don't think CMU is a total Asian school, although there are a lot. There's a good balance though, between the students and you don't really notice it in classes.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: If you're an athlete, varsity sports are important to you. If you'd like to do sports but not competitively, intramural is great. Club sports are also a lot of fun and many people participate in those.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life hosts lots of events that are available for everyone to join, and it's not necessary that you become a part of a frat or sorority because they understand that sometimes Greek life isn't for everyone.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The administration is pretty lax, and you only really get in trouble if you do something horrible. The biggest thing I've seen people get in trouble for is cheating, which is a serious violation of the honor code.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There's enough guys, definitely. But a lot of them aren't very interested in dating or seeking relationships. Sometimes you'll meet a guy and think he's the one but it's probably safe to say he's thinking about when they're going to play video games with their friends or eat food. Like they say, the odds are good, but the goods are odd.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I wasnt a aprt of it so i really havent the slightest idea.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Never really went to sports games to be honest but they were okay
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: There's amnesty for alcohol use and things like that. Sexual assaults and really serious crimes like that are more recently being taken more seriously, but things like attendance is on a per-teacher basis and not always taken seriously at all.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: People aren't that interested in the varsity sports because we are division three. I feel like intramural sports are more popular because a lot of clubs participate as teams.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is more affordable than at other schools. And Greek sing is fun. But sororities are definitely clique-y and put off a more friendly persona during recruitment than they actually have.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: As a student athlete I go to all sports events on campus to support my fellow athletes. I was a super fan in high school, and my high school did have a lot more spirit than CMU does. However, if we have a team that is doing well and competing for nationals or in a big tournament on campus it is amazing how many people show up to support them. Most of the time the fans are fellow athletes, but we are working on getting more people involved in the athletic community. The great part about CMU is that it isn't like a D1 school where athletes are untouchable, I am friends with people on every team here as well as people in dance groups, theater, anything you can imagine.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Super diverse, you will have a spot somewhere no matter who you are
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sports are just kinda there
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Visitation in dorms virtually has no regulations which is fantastic and makes life  lot easier. They are super serious about pot use in the dorms, DONT DO IT YOU WILL GET CAUGHT.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I personally am not in a sorority and I have many friends in Greek Life, and I also attend frat parties regularly so I think the relations are great. However if you are a guy and you want to get into parties your should strongly consider either joining Greek life or making A LOT of friends who are in Greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The dating scene at CMU has been trashed on for ages. It is getting significantly better. The ratio has been steadily improving (the most recent incoming class had a 55/45 male/female ratio) and students are not ugly by any means. Those that are a bit reclusive aren't very visible as they don't go outside to socialize much. What makes CMU students great for dating, is that everyone is very motivated and interested in what they want to do in college which shows through in their confidence and makes everyone more attractive. Yea they may not look the best, but you'll never really have a dull conversation with a student at Carnegie Mellon
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Honestly, Greek life at CMU is great. By no means do you have to join to have a good social life but it sure does help.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Although Varsity sports are not big by any means, most people end up playing some sort of intramural sport at some point in their time at CMU. There are also many club teams you can join by just walking on, leading to many options for those who want to play sports, but not at a varsity level. Varsity Training facilities are also open to the campus most of the time when the Varsity teams do not need them
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Generally helpful if you want to do something they like
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Overall, the administration is very average. Acts such as plagiarism can get you in a ton of trouble, while blowing off class all the time won't even get you a slap on the wrist.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone I've meet in Greek life is genuinely nice and the majority of them hold important positions in the community. They take their philanthropies very seriously and contribute a lot to the community. There's a strict no-hazing policy which the Panhellenic Council and Interfraternity Council, which govern most of the Greek organizations. There are two locations for Greek housing, apartment style-buildings and standalone houses, which are nicer. Greeks are viewed similarly to non-Greeks, and there are no particular advantages to being Greek other than being surrounded by a community of leaders and being exposed to a few opportunities which are only offered to people in Greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's fairly easy to do what you want on campus, whether it means creating a new organization or creating a new study track for yourself. The administrators are available to help students pursue their goals, no matter what they are. The honor code is taken seriously, especially with computer science. There are checkers in place to ensure plagarism doesn't occur, and the punishment is generally severe, such as getting an automatic 0 in the class.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: As an athlete, I'm very satisfied with the facilities here, but unfortunately, most people assume that the sports are bad. We often have teams do well in conference and go to the NCAA tournament. Sports require a lot of commitment and most professors respect that.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The administration doesn't seem to interfere too much with student life. The Interfraternity Council can be a little strict, but they only apply to Greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: While Greek life isn't considered big by any means at CMU, it's well-respected and full of great people. Every house definitely has their own personality, and each is very passionate about the philanthropy they support.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: the guys and girls arent super hot for the most part but you can definitely find hot people in greek life and on sports teams
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: it gets a bad rep but its honestly so great. im in a frat and i love it
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: the facilities are good, especially if you're an athlete
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Coaching staffs are  typically reviewed as worse than the staff of  most students' high schools. Track was particularly bad. Football also not great. Nobody cared.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: I just joined a sorority with a strong anti-sorority bias but I'm loving it so far.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: This is just not an athletic school. Division three and football games are occasionally attended but basically nothing else is.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The cheating policy is very strict and if you're caught drinking in a dorm you'll get in trouble but I'd say is pretty average
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Strict when it needs to be, lenient when it can afford to be
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Carnegie Mellon is one of the most diverse places I've been to. It's awesome how many different people are so passionate about different things.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The administration is reasonable and supportive. They don't get in the way of the college experience and are there when you need them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is present but not over bearing. They have houses close to campus and throw pretty good parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I am a club sports athlete and I would really like more athletic pride. The school is working towards better athletic facilities but the school needs more athletic participation and pride.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics at Carnegie Mellon are not very obvious in the community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's not too strict as a whole, but sometimes it is either excessive or too lenient.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The small amount of Greek life has little affect on the social atmosphere of campus.  You usually do not know or even care to know if someone is in a sorority or fraternity or not.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's great to be surrounded by people from so many different backgrounds and cultures.  There are always great events showcasing the different cultures, religions, and beliefs.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Extremely diverse socially. Not so much economically, but getting better.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Helpful. Very present but not overbearing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's fine. No one will treat you differently if you're in it or not.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It really depends on who you meet. Some people tend towards antisocial--studying rather than hanging out. Others like to party all the time.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is no pressure to join Greek life, but it's definitely a great opportunity and I think everybody could find a good-fit Greek organization to join.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The school is very diverse and extremely accepting of all people, but there still can be tendencies to form cliques based on national/ethnic background.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Overall pretty lenient unless you do something completely out of line.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are many opportunities to get involved but there's not a strong sports culture.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We have almost half the students from out of the country, which introduces a wide mix of culture/belief/food/etc
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek lives grants you access to a lot more social events, such as having a group to build a booth with during Carnival or having an automatic in at frat parties, but if you are not involved in greek life there are still plenty of opportunities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: My school is very laid back because they know how hard we work. If we need to go to class, we will, and if we are really being bad on a weekend, they will get the police involved. But with the success our graduates have, the students must know how to handle their class work and social lives
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Depending on who you are friends with, the rating of girls and guys can vary
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Our football team is D3 and okay. The amount of spectators varies depending on who the opposing team is
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: People are generally not judgemental because a lot of the student body consists of nerds and odd personalities anyway.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There definitely is a lot of school spirit, but that is based around the "fence" and other school things moreso than sports, I would say.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There is such great diversity throughout the students and faculty of the school that CMU is really a melting pot in and of itself. There are a lot of international students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: All of the programs are fairly rigorous, creating a certain stress culture around campus among students. Teachers deal with this stress very nicely, and are lenient and understanding for the most part. However, I would say that students are personally affected more than anything due to the stress they put themselves under, wanting to accomplish more than the given curriculum for their major, which is usually already very demanding.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: No one really gets into too much trouble.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: No one really cares about sports except for those who participate in them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of different ethnicities, foreigners keep to themselves.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Every college has their good looking and not-so-fortunate-looking people. I see a lot of nice looking people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: During orientation, the RAs told us a bunch of rules, most of it focused on drug/alcohol use. CMu takes underaged drinking seriously, though there is an "Amnesty" thing that can sort of get you out of sticky situations.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: In short, everyone here can get a friend easily. I'm in a friend group that consists of 3 Chinese/Taiwanese (including me), 1 Indian, and 4 White. Race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, etc, won't hinder you from other people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: We're not really a "sporty" school, so honestly, it's not a big thing in CMU.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Campus rules are generally pretty reasonable. They don't condone underage drinking and drug-use. The policies are there to better students' academic and social lives, so it is easy to comply by these rules.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: There is so much diversity on campus that everyone is accepted. There are many clubs for ethnic/racial minorities. There are people of various economic backgrounds, but people of all economic backgrounds are accepted. CMU is very liberal and political beliefs are all accepted. All religions are accepted and all sexual orientations are accepted.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I feel like there are many Greek activities on campus and we usually see them on the lawn hosting BBQs and various other activities. There is definitely a lot of Greek pride, but no one gets chastised for not joining Greek life. Greek housing is available as there are Greek quads. However, I don't find Greek housing particularly opulent or glamorous. I prefer other housing options.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of diversity. Community is welcoming.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Minority students (Black, Hispanic) can tend to be separated from the remainder of the population.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: More people attend intramural games than varsity games. No one cares about sports here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: No one really cares about sororities or fraternities here. A lot of people are in them but you don't really gain or lose anything either way.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are people from all walks of life here. Students represent many nationalities, religions, political beliefs and sexual orientations.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Yeah...sports. They might exist here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's a pretty relaxed campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I like the diversity here. Minorities are also respected.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Student support of Varsity athletics could be much better. IMs are pretty popular. The facilities are decent, but not great for the cost of tuition. The rec facilities are getting renovated though and the varsity facilities will be improved after that
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: CMU is extremely big on being diverse.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Some of the girls are cute.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The RA should be more assertive with his residents
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We're not a very attractive school outside of the drama department. But the guys are very nice and willing to talk to you and if you're geeky, there's plenty to talk to.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Many of my friends are in Greek life and love it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I wish there was more school spirit
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It helps people grow a lot, but sometimes they get sucked into frats, and never appear again.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The school is pretty lenient in most areas other than academics. The honor code is taken very seriously (for good reason), and kids do get suspended or expelled for cheating. Attendance is pretty lenient, as many classes do not bother to take roll. Rarely will RAs or campus police bust students for alcohol use in dorms unless it is blatant and noise levels are completely over the top. Visitation is not an issue at all; many students have friends stay with them for a few days in campus housing. Campus police are reasonable, and is out to ensure safety of students rather than prosecute them. In recent years, however, the school has encourage them to crack down on parties on Beeler (the street right across from campus where many students live and parties happen) which has quieted down the house party scene a bit.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Though CMU is known for not having the best looking students, almost everyone you meet is friendly, interesting and genuine. Attractive people are less abundant than elsewhere, but can be found. A positive for some (and negative for others) is the lack of need to dress up for class; it can be as acceptable to wear what you slept in as a blazer and button down. Social life is completely what you make of it. I absolutely love the social life I have forged for myself at CMU. I party when I want to, which has thus far been often, but can just as much enjoy a night in with friends at their house or apartment, or at an on or off campus activity. Greek Life is a huge source of social life, from activities to campus involvement to parties. As far as clubs and organizations go almost anything you can think of is available, and if it isn't it is very easy to start one.
You can, again, create whatever social life you want to for yourself at CMU, and this includes relationships. Though some girls and guys experience the 'CMU syndrome', whereby they get a bit uppity due to the slimmer selection of attractive people, random hookups, casual dating, and serious relationships are all found for those who seek them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Diversity was one of my main draws to Carnegie Mellon. There are people of every race, religion, nationality, orientation, and political standing. Being one of the most expensive schools in the country, economic background may be relatively homogeneous with most students upper middle class and above. However, everyone comes to work hard and pursue promising work, so no one is looked down upon for their economic status. With such a diverse campus (17% international and less than 50% white) it is impossible not to respect every kind of person you come across. My fraternity pledge class of 13 alone represents the US, Canada, Venezuela, Ukraine, India and Kenya as countries of origin. You will have the incredible experience of meeting people from everywhere in the world at this school. I have learned more from interacting with people at Carnegie than I have from classes.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I run cross country and even though other people don't care about it I love it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The police are easy to get along with. They are fairly strict about drinking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Average but not great. Fun, friendly, good friends.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Really fun if you partake, but it's not a big deal if you don't.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The hook up culture is there, but so is the dating culture.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I dont know about guys but the girls here are not very pretty
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are several opportunities but not many people are interested because of a heavy workload
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is not that big of a deal and people don't care whether you are involved or not.  However, those who are involved in Greek life do not have much free time outside of it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is there for parties and some other events, but it doesn't dominate. It's not a big deal if you are in a frat or sorority, and it is not a big deal if you never set foot in one. It's nice because you can go to frat parties, which can be fun, but it's not a status thing.If you're in one though, it dominates your life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Plenty of Asians, Indians, and Caucasians. Probably even thirds or so it seems, but much more diversity than at other schools. Many different religions and people of different sexual orientations. Everyone is accepted here, so diversity is prominent
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics facility is too good. The teams from CMU are nationally recognized.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The diversity on campus is fantastic, although it is difficult to discern whether caucasian or asian is considered the "majority".
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life isn't super big here. While its presence on campus is definitely noticeable, it's not a big deal whether or not you're in one.  The university has very strict regulations on Greek life that sometimes makes it difficult to have fun events
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I was too busy studying and figuring out my major to think about greek-life, and i never planned on joining anyway! Greek-life starts to really matter around carnival however, when getting funds from their organizations help them to build bigger and better booths compared to the less-funded clubs/organizations. For me, Greek-life was known more for its charity events than it's parties,though there were parties I never bothered with them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are tons of diverse people here, whether it is lgbtq, religion(there was a great discussion on jesus in islam this past semester) or people of color, and each group usually has its own club and voice on campus. It is very refreshing to see, though to those not used to diversity in their hometowns it might come as a culture shock. Students and staff alike will speak a variety of languages across campus and may be willing to share their culture and viewpoints, though it's always important to be polite about this! As many people may not want to talk about one thing or another, no culture is a monolith after all! There are many international students, with a split between South Asian and East Asian, but a smaller percentage of black, latin@, and native American students on campus. There are prejudices between the different races and cultures, but that is inescapable wherever you go. Plus it's liberal enough here that it is not suffocating.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is present, but not huge. Mostly about service and hosting events on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The CMU cops could usually care less with alcohol and parties and stuff.  They will give parties time to disband before IDing people even when they know everyone is underage. One time they just said to turn the music down, not party is over. If you're in a dorm, the RAs will probably be more strict.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Sports aren't huge and a lot of students could care less. Games can be fun if you enjoy the game and have friends to cheer for though. School spirit comes from non-athletic pride.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I applaude the athletes at CMU, not just because they're pretty darn good, but because they continue to do what they love despite the fact that CMU doesn't do the best job of making sure we all have school spirit. I spent the entirety of last year discovering that we actually had sports teams!!! And I still didn't end up going to any sporting events because in order to know when one is going on, you'd have to know someone on the team. Coming from a high school full of school pride, it just makes me a little sad.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The police aren't total douches here and are usually helpful.  They really only bust parties/etc. if there's a complaint or someone gets hurt.  Professors aren't very flexible with illnesses, etc.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Well about half this school is asian, many of whom actually grew up in Asia.  A lot of indians, average amount of black people and seemingly few whites.  This school is obnoxiously liberal and hostile to any opposing viewpoint.  They're (rightfully) accepting of homosexuals, no one really talks about religion or economic background.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life was really strong here a few years back but most of the good houses got kicked off campus.  If you want to have as much of a real college social experience as you can get at CMU, going greek really helps.  Pi Kappa Alpha and Sigma anything are a good time.  We don't have your typical "frat castles" but rather old brown houses.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: We're not d1 but most of the teams do decently.  Tennis and football usually win the most.  Fan support is weak especially for anything that isn't football or soccer.  The gym is tiny but the one for the varsity athletes is sick from what I hear.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The people here are fairly average when looking at the population as a whole. Some people are better than others depending on who you like to hang out with. The students here are very diverse.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The school is overly harsh on drinking in dorms. They call the police and/or accuse students at even the littlest hint of alcohol, but many RA's play favorites and only ridicule certain students. This is unacceptable. Overall though the school isn't too strict, unless talking about drinking and academic integrity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: If you use good judgement and remain mindful and respectful of others, you should have no problem with authorities. And let's face it, if you are smart enough to be here, you should be smart enough to know what is a dumb idea that will get you into trouble.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek Life at CMU is a breath of fresh air compared to a lot of schools and extremely underrated. Most fraternities and sororities are not focused on partying, and almost no fraternity or sorority actually hazes pledges. Many of the major philanthropic events (e.g. Sigma Alpha Epsilon's Donut Dash, Delta Gamma's Anchor Slam, or IFC/Panhel's Greek Sing) and social events (e.g. AEPi's Foam Party, Kappa Sigma's Beach Party, and Sigma Alpha Epsilon's "Dante's Inferno") are run by Greek orgs. If you're not sure whether Greek Life is for you, rush and form your own opinion regardless of what you've heard or assumed about Greek Life!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'd rate the "Strictness" at CMU as average. I have visited other schools that seem a lot more strict than what I experienced at Carnegie Mellon. However, I think good advice is to be smart about the decisions you make. If you are about to do something that could potentially get you in trouble, chances are, you probably just shouldn't do it. Because no matter what I say, who knows whose hands your fate could lie in.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: The police force are pretty nice, helpful, and lenient as long as you are not doing anything extremely stupid.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The guys range from your average jocks to your computer nerds.  Then there's everyone in between as well.  Most of the CFA guys have that urban/ boho vibe and are generally much hotter than CIT people. CIT/ SCS   guys are mostly Asian and average...like boy next door average.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The campus police's main goal is to make sure that you are safe, not get you in trouble. If you are being obnoxious or inconspicuous you might get cited, but most of the times if a party is busted they tell everyone to go home. Noise complaints are taken very seriously in the dorms though, so be considerate to your neighbors.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Carnegie Mellon is not a place you come to for its athletic programs. That being said, I still think athletes find enough to do here, and if you don't want to devote your college career to sports, you can still get your exercise in through club sports, or through our well-equipped gyms.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Carnegie Mellon is known for its international student population. There are tons of different kinds of people, and everyone is very accepting. Walking to class, people play cricket in one field and frisbee in the other. You can't walk across campus without hearing at least a few different languages being spoken.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review:
Carnegie Mellon is strict about cheating. If you are caught, the ramifications are extremely serious. 
Socially, the campus police are realistic. They have programs set up to help ensure the safety of everyone first, such as blue lights around the campus. Amnesty is another example of the understanding by the police.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Carnegie Mellon, on average is an extremely diverse university. If by extremely diverse you mean it's not dominated by all white people. We boast students from all 50 states and numerous countries. Also, the campus is an extremely liberal campus but is accepting of different beliefs. From what I've noticed, it's an LGBTQ friendly campus, and is not quick to judge. 

Where Carnegie Mellon falters, is not in the numbers, but in the immersion of the students. We have many of them, but cliques of internationals and other factors and exist, and some students can feel isolated at that. There are still numerous opportunities for you to meet others!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: When it comes to international students, CMU has a large population of students from India, China, and South Korea. Except for this population there are few international students. The campus does have students with a wide variety of economic backgrounds, and also a good amount of LBGT people. Politically we're quite liberal, with a few libertarians here and there.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Carnegie Mellon prides itself on its ethnic diversity, but the truth is that the vast majority of students are white or Asian. Black, Hispanic, etc. students don't comprise nearly as much of the campus. There is quite a bit of diversity with sexual orientation, but political beliefs here seem to be pretty homogeneous.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The school is not very strict about drinking. If you cause problems, you can get in trouble, but if you are just throwing a party, campus police will just break it up with a warning.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is great if you want to get more involved in volunteering, campus groups (such as student council), and spend many, MANY hours building carnival booths and raising money and performing broadway shows in the spring (Greek Sing). The houses can be good for meeting lots of people, but DO NOT expect a huge party scene. The university has kicked off 5 fraternities in the last 5 years that had been party houses. CMU doesn't tolerate rowdy Greek houses.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Students rarely known about varsity games unless they are on the sports team. There is a strong IM on campus, but do not apply to everyone.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life definitely exists, and there are stereotypes for each fraternity and sorority, but you don't have to feel obligated to join. I have a great social life and am involved in the party scene without being greek. No one cares what you do as long as you're happy doing what you want.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: There are always CMU police cars driving around. The campus is pretty small- they circulate around the neighborhood constantly. It's kind of unfortunate because they're always prowling around on the street where all the house parties are, but in the end, they're really only there to keep us safe. They won't stop you if you're stumbling down the sidewalk with a group of friends, but if you're alone and in the middle of the street, they'll stop and get you back home. In the end, it keeps the campus safe. There's also a great amnesty policy.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics aren't very popular at CMU. Varsity sports get minimal recognitions and support from the campus community. However, intramural sports are pretty popular for students looking to blow off steam and win free swag.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: International Community – Carnegie Mellon has an incredibly diverse community. We have a very large number of international students from all around the world, and people of every race and ethnicity you could imagine.  I overhear conversations in foreign languages on a daily basis, and feel that I am immersed in a very close representation of the world's true cultural diversity.  Most cultures are represented on campus by several student groups, which gives every student an opportunity to explore his or her culture with others.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I hope CMU accepts more latinas. That would be a +
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Better Chances If You're Asian – there are a handful of good looking asians on campus but i'm not so sure about everyone else. drama kids are obviously really great but stay away from engineering/computer science lol
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: We have some decent teams.  Football had 30 winning seasons or something like that.  I think tennis and track are good.  Fan support could be better.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: A lot of asian, indian and white.  A lot of international kids which is cool.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Not that strict.  Occasionally a party will get broken up but not much else really happens along those lines.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is noticeable but not huge.  Like 1 in 4 people go greek so its not like it dominates everything but its fun and worthwhile.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Hot girls are concentrated around the arts department.  Pretty polar.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Not as Bad as They Say – Carnegie Mellon has a reputation of being a bad-looking campus, and sure, there are the kids who haven't showered, changed, or shaved for weeks, but overall it could definitely be worse. It's not too difficult to look across the Cut on an average busy day and pick out a few attractive people. Similarly, while some people are extremely awkward in dealing with members of the opposite sex(or any people, for that matter) social interaction generally tends to be quite smooth and normal among students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not Your Classic "Fratty" School – Though fraternities and sororities on campus do have a very obvious presence, it's much different from the atmosphere at many other schools. Though Greek organizations are known for hosting parties on campus, most of the time they can be seen promoting a fundraiser that they are holding or serving the campus and community in a positive way.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not Too Bad – Campus strictness isn't too bad. Underage drinking in the dorms is fairly strict, but as far as parties go, parties are busted and people are free to go, the owners may get cited. One of the strictest things on campus is the network policy where violators downloading music or movies can have their network suspended for over a month.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There If You Want to Join – Those in frats and sororities are noticeably some of the more outgoing students on campus, but there is little pressure to join. If it's for you, you'll definitely enjoy having a consistent group of people to hang out with. If it's not for you, there are a ton of other groups on campus that do just as much as the frats and sororities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty Good Actually – This school gets an unfair bad rep. Most people here are fun and NOT ugly. In fact most are fairly attractive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I've met people here that I never would have met otherwise. There is a large international student population and everyone is very accepting. Politically, the campus is largely leftist, and sometimes those of differing viewpoints are not as accepted.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Fraternity Quad – Reasonably available if you want to be in a frat or sorority.  Good parties when you are a freshman/soph but they get exceedingly boring as you progress in your collegiate career.  For those that don't get much social interaction in classes (i.e. lecture courses), greek is a good way to make friends.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Slim Pickins – Pickings are slim, and those that there are can be a little too into themselves
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: For Your Own Good – There is no drinking allowed in freshman dorms, and you can get into a lot of trouble if you're caught. However, most RAs are pretty lenient about it. We have a really great amnesty program where your friend can call EMS for you if you're in danger of alcohol poisoning, and neither of you will get in trouble.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not an Issue – I have not yet found myself in a situation regarding any school policies or the enforcement of such policies, but several of my friends have. From their experiences, they say the university is fair and very understanding, especially if it is your first offense.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sport Are Surprisingly Good – Varsity sports aren't super big, but club sports allow a lot of students who can't make the time commitment to still get out and practice.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Somewhat Strict – Campus police are few but do tend to be fairly strict and if you aren't smart about where you decide to party on the weekends, you might catch yourself in a tough spot. Usually there are plenty of off-campus opportunities to have fun, and the city police have more important things to do than worry about citing 100 students at a party.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Very Diverse – The campus is very diverse. It seems that the international students take up half the student body.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Prett Strict – the campus is most strict about academics, but they can also be very strict when it comes to citations, violence, vandalism, etc. usually though when an RA finds alc or weed in a students room, they just make them throw it out, rarely will they report it, unless the house fellow (an adult dorm advisor) or campus police are the ones who find it. and public intoxication is pretty much a given during carnival, and as long as you don't do anything too stupid, they don't care.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Not Too Strict – We have great police and a policy called "Amnesty" which helps protect against getting in trouble for alcohol. So it's not too bad
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is a decent percentage of Greek students on campus, but not a lot compared to most schools. One of the great things about Greek Life here is that, for the IFC and Panhellenic chapters, if you rush there is pretty much always a spot for you in one of the organizations. And the organizations are varied enough that one of them will fit your personality.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of Azns – There are a lot and of many different types. Be aware. Be prepared.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: No School Spirit – I participate in Varsity athletics and athletes support athletes.... Thats about it
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Most of the pressure here is what students put on themselves, not what comes from the administration.  Teachers and department heads have a lot of say in their own academic policies.  Also, most clubs here govern themselves and choose their own rules.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The diversity is quite good,yet a over high percentage of Asians and very few Europeans.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We're a school of nerds, but we don't all look like it. Everyone at this school, for the most part, is extremely intelligent. It's not like a normal university: sadly, stereotypically, not everyone is necessarily model-pretty. Besides looks, everyone here is generally very nice. Every time I've lost something, someone has picked it up and returned it to lost and found, or will go as far as finding your email and letting you know that they found something you lost. There have only been minor thefts, but that's been from leaving items out in the open in public areas, which is pretty much a stupid thing to do. General summary: nice, smart, people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone here is highly diverse, and very accepting. It's not uncommon to hear multiple people speaking a different language on your way to class. It's actually a minority to only be able to speak one language. Sexual orientation and political beliefs are shared and are also diverse, yet accepted.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: All Sorts of People – There's at least a few of every type of people, but there are a very noticeably large number of Koreans.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty Slack – You can pretty much do what you want as long as your not stupid about it. Citations happen occasionally but not a lot
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Carnegie Mellon is like any other college, wanting the best for its students but also concerned about the business side of affairs. Most of the policies are there for student safety and convenience. Amnesty for example--if an underage student starts to become dangerously inebriated within 2 miles of campus, a friend may call campus police for them and be taken to the hospital without mention of the incident on any records. Occasionally policies are added to ensure that the University does not have litigation trouble, but they for the most part do not effect the student body.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Passionate People Everywhere – To be honest, not everyone is as concerned with their looks as you might find elsewhere but that doesn't mean the students here are unattractive by any means. Each student's interests tend to revolve around their major since academics consume most of their time but close to 90% of students make time for friends, clubs, activities so the social life here is really underrated.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Carnegie Mellon is a very diverse community! there are people from all backgrounds and there are many opportunities to meet new people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: SO. MUCH. DIVERISTY. Whites are not a majority at CMU - they only make up about 40% of the student body.  Coming from a really small town, it was actually kind of shocking.  At CMU you can't walk five feet without running into someone of a different race or from another country.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The professors here don't care about their students. Sure, they all want us to theoretically learn the material, but they don't really try to help. They think that a 'C' is okay to give to a hardworking student because "it's passing", but they fail to realize what we're all really here for: TO GET JOBS. News flash! Getting a job is hard to do when your GPA makes you look like an idiot.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The academics are challenging yet doable.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The professors are all great and very qualified. Registration process can be a bit stressful because you're randomly assigned a time to register and waitlists suck, but people forget to use their academic advisers and they are incredibly helpful. Workload gets very heavy so time management is crucial. The first few weeks of classes are light then midterm season hits and it doesn't really end until finals. Most people study in Hunt or Wean library, and the school just put up some new study spaces in the university extension. Other students study in empty classrooms, which I like. I prefer to have more private rooms (because classrooms are taken during the day), but the school doesn't have many of those.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I get overwhelmed sometimes but it's fun
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: You will learn so much by coming to CMU. You will leave knowing that your time here was worth it, no matter what your GPA is, and no matter what opportunities you are offered after.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: There are many aspects of CMU, but so far the Engineering program is awesome, and my dealings with professors so far is great. Its nice that CMU offers intro to Engineering courses, so you can really decide what field you want to major in. There are many areas you can go to study, you are not just limited to your dorm. The registration process was not that difficult, and there were all kinds of things to do and be introduced to.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Academics are intense and you will lose sleep but it's generally because you like what you are doing.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: It's not that difficult (MechE). Admission is almost purely statistics, but they also take your essay into account to show passion. Its staying the program that usually poses a bigger challenge.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The opportunities at CMU are amazing. This school really wants you to succeed and encourages you to experiment and branch out and explore at every turn.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: (As an engineer) It's amazing. If you are interested in a topic, you can go all-in. There are numerous workshops for hands-on experience and you can really immerse yourself in the topic at hand
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I give the academics 4 stars not because they aren't fantastic but because the workload is AWFUL. I can't describe how difficult it is here. Engineer, art student, whatever you are you will be up in the wee hours of the morning studying no matter what you do. Its rewarding but it comes at a very high cost. Most professors don't have thick accents, but many TA's are foreign and it's a struggle to understand their lectures. But they really are top of the line and if you can stick with it, you'll learn a lot. However you'll need to struggle through many 300-person lecture classes to get to the smaller ones first.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Being a math major is tough, but the work really pays off especially if you want to double in another technical major, especially computer science. The overlap is pretty good and a double is easy to pick up, a minor even more so. There is a lot of work involved and sometimes the professors aren't that great but if you get a great TA, then you're in luck. If you have a great professor and a great TA, even better. How you use your professors and TAs varies from class to class but after the first week you'll have a feel for them and how you should use them. The internships are a little harder if you're strictly math, so a lot of math majors find that doing CS really helps them because a lot of software companies and technology companies really like the dual combination of math and CS.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: There's great variety and the professors actually care about teaching you the material, even if they can't do that that well. There's a lot of work involved as with every class but if you can balance out your time and not procrastinate you'll be okay. The registration process is a bit frustrating, especially for freshmen but that's because there is a lottery and juniors go first, sophomores next and so on.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Every major requires a lot of time commitment. Most technical majors have a lot of work to do but it really pays off because they end up getting the best jobs. CMU is #1 for CS and as such, everyone involves themselves in a little bit of CS because having it as a minor certainly doesn't hurt your chances out in the job world.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: They are great never better anywhere else if we are being honest
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: they were alright, classes are hard, dont get over whelemed
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: My major is decent for internships, but the track programs are kind of dated and need to be revamped and renamed because they are loosely structured. The business core is kind of a wildcard; you'll get some really great classes and some very disappointing ones.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: We have a variety of job fairs with amazing companies throughout the year. Our biggest fair, the TOC, happens in both the fall and spring and companies such as google, microsoft, boeing, and many more come to try and recruit CMU students for internships and work opportunities. There are also specialized job fairs for individual majors throughout the year as well.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Everyone here deserves to be here. With that said, almost everyone here was a straight A student in AP classes, or an amazing service project leader, or the star of every play. You have to be ready to fail here. It's college, you're adjusting and with everyone being so smart your professors are going to push you way beyond your limits. You will be stressed out at points and try to pull all nighters (DON'T DO IT) but all the hard work is worth it. Your GPA may not be as beautiful as it was in high school, but you're getting an education from one of the best universities in the nation. You're constantly presented with amazing job opportunities from amazing companies, but you have these opportunities because you're a CMU student and that's enough for them to show interest in you.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I love CivE it's awesome and the administrators are great!
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: You need to be yourself and trying to be super academic and intellectual will make them not even give you a second look because guess what, it's CARNEGIE MELLON....EVERYONE IS INTELLIGENT. So really talk about things your passionate about and things that make you stand out from an average student who would be applying to a school of this caliber
Academics.Author: College Freshman
